snippet: A disgruntled business partner gave a Florida newspaper files that led to scrutiny of Anthony P. Bosch, a clinic operator accused of supplying players with banned drugs.
abstract: Doping scandal rocking Major League Baseball apparently began as a tiff between Florida anti-aging clinic owner Anthony P Bosch and an investor in his company Biogenesis; Porter Fischer, former client turned business partner, felt spurned over a $4,000 investment that went sour and worked with Miami New Times newspaper to bring Bosch down.

byline.contributor: Nick Madigan contributed reporting from Coral Gables, Fla.

lead_paragraph: A disgruntled business partner gave a Florida newspaper files that led to scrutiny of Anthony P. Bosch, a clinic operator accused of supplying players with banned drugs.

headline.main: The $4,000 Deal Gone Sour Behind the Doping Scandal
headline.print_headline: The $4,000 Deal Gone Sour Behind the Doping Scandal
